help.description: Select option --help when running to get help for each parameter

input_outputs.title: Input/Outputs
input_outputs.description: Paths for sample input and Outputs

sampleFile.description: Path to the .tsv sample file, of format V1 or V2, containing the Family ID and path to GVCF files
sampleFile.help_text:
Supply the path and filename of the sample file. The file must be tab delimited, including the family ID in the first column, then the path to the .gvcf.gz files of each family member in each following column. 
If the sampleFileFormat is "V2", the format is similar but the second column must be the sequencing type "WES" or "WGS"

outputDir.description: Directory for the outputs files, including the reports

referenceGenome.help_text: Contains the path to the directory that contains the reference fasta genome.

broad.description: Directory containing the references for vqsr and the intervalsFile
broad.help_text:
Path to the directory containing 5 important files: 
1. The intervalsFile whose name is defined in the intervalsFile parameter
2. The Hapmap file for vqsr training
3. The omni2.5 file for vqsr training
4. The 1000G SNP reference file for vqsr training
5. The dbsnp database for vqsr training

vepCache.help_text: Path to the vepCache directory, which is usually installed by vep by default. It should contain at least the homo_sapien/111_GRCh38/ directory.

intervalsFile.description: Namefile of the genome interval we want to use
intervalsFile.help_text: Used during the CombineGVCFs step to indicate the regions of interest

sampleFileFormat.description: The format of the sample file, either "V1" or "V2"
sampleFileFormat.help_text: See our README for more information about the two file format: https://github.com/Ferlab-Ste-Justine/cqdg-denovo-pipeline

vepCpu.description: Determines the -fork option that will be used for rep
vepCpu.help_text: Allows forking during the vet step, to make it faster

TSfilterSNP.help_text: This value is required by the VQSR step

TSfilterINDEL.help_text: This value is required by the VQSR step

hardFilters.help_text:
Must be an array containing each desired filter. Each filter must be formatted with the desired name and expression, for example
[[name: 'QD1', expression: 'QD < 1.0'],[name: 'QD2', expression: 'QD < 2.0]]

sequencingType.description: Either "WGS" for Whole Genome Sequencing or "WES" for Whole Exome Sequencing
